p: It is estimated that 15–30% of COVID-19 patients have hypertension (HTN) [ 16]. Indeed, a meta-analysis ( n = 46,248) including eight studies from China demonstrated that the most common cardiac comorbidity was HTN (17 ± 7%, 95% CI 14–22%) [ 83]. ACE2 receptor expression is similar in adipose and non-adipose tissues, but as obese individuals have more adipose tissue in the body, they may have an increased number of receptors. Although some have reported obesity to be a risk factor for COVID infection, more data are required to see if obese individuals are indeed more vulnerable [ 84].
